name: SWAP Test
description: Measure |⟨ψ|φ⟩|² between two quantum states using a Fredkin (controlled-SWAP) gate.
long_description: The SWAP test non-destructively estimates the overlap |⟨ψ|φ⟩|² of two quantum states. An ancilla qubit in superposition controls a SWAP between the two state registers. P(ancilla=1) = (1 - |⟨ψ|φ⟩|²)/2. For identical states: P(1)=0, for orthogonal: P(1)=0.5. This circuit tests |ψ⟩=|0⟩ vs |φ⟩=|+⟩, so |⟨0|+⟩|²=0.5 → P(1) = 0.25.

references.title: Buhrman et al. (2001). Quantum Fingerprinting. PRL 87, 167902

author: OpenQC Community
